purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then send this data to remote servers for tracking purposes.
flows: MAC addresses -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in array _tmp_2
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Insecure data exfiltration via HTTP instead of HTTPS
analysis: This code implements a data collection mechanism that gathers system identifiers (MAC addresses, hostname, user info) and sends them to external tracking servers. The presence of hardcoded domain names in _tmp_2 suggests it's designed to communicate with specific command-and-control servers. The use of rejectUnauthorized: false indicates an attempt to bypass SSL security checks, which is commonly seen in malicious software to avoid detection. The code also uses base64 encoding on sensitive data before transmission, suggesting some level of obfuscation.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of malicious tracking software or spyware that collects system information and exfiltrates it to remote servers without user knowledge or consent.
